PPLoc: http://us.kuehne-nagel.com   (Policy is available as .pdf file in "Documents" section)
activities: Kuehne + Nagel Inc. ("KN") is the U.S. subsidiary of Kuehne + Nagel Management AG, its Swiss parent. KN may receive personal employee data from its affiliate companies in the European Union or Switzerland.  Such information may relate to immigration status, other general employment matters, among which are compensation, training, and benefits, as well as information pertaining to an individual's compliance with corporate codes of conduct (FCPA, Anti-Bribery, Corporate Governance).
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human Resources data is received by KN, whether in electronic form or in hard copy.
privacyprograms: KN, through its HR, IT, and Legal departments, will implement and monitor compliance with Safe Harbor principles.  This compliance will be self-regulatory.
recoursemech: The primary and preferred means to resolve disputes is through an internal review on the part of KN's Human Resources department.  In the event such approach should prove unsatisfactory to an individual, KN will advise said individual that such matters are to be referred to the relevant Data Protection Authority, whether in the EU (DPA) or Switzerland (FDPIC).
